chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/ Minor Pass < 16 yrs.)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Ray Field was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/ Minor Pass < 16 yrs.), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Possession of Drug Paraphernalia. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay fine and costs.  If not paid within 2 years, to be converted to civil judgment.
Defendant is to submit and comply with an assessment by the approved public treatment facility for your county of residence, as defined in s.51.45(2)(c), Wis. Stats

charges.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/ Minor Pass < 16 yrs.)

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay costs only.  If not paid within 2 years, to be converted to civil judgment.

Defendant Kyle Ray Field in court with attorney Brian H. Wright.  John Harrison Sacia appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court adopts joint recommendation, def sentenced.  Court orders bench warrant quashed.

DA Taavi McMahon appears for the State.  Atty Wright appears in person.  Defendant appears by phone from the Jackson County Jail.  Defendant pleads NG.  State moves to Quash warrant - court grants.  State moves to reinstate bond - court grants.  PTC/STC set.  Bond reinstated.

Spoke with Jackson Co. Jail in regards to Kyle appearing by video. 9:00 is also their court/jail appearance time block so they will have to do any of their cases first, and then they will have him ready for his appearance.
